attributes.action: Fairer Toll and Parking Enforcement – Protect Drivers from Excessive Fines
attributes.additional_details: Car parks (private and council-run) must display clear signage showing payment is required and the maximum stay allowed. If machines are broken, signs must state the preferred alternative payment method or confirm no payment is required. Where signage is unclear or missing, only the original parking fee should be reclaimed. Penalties must be capped at £10–£20, ensuring fines are proportionate. Excessive fines for minor oversights, such as a £2 unpaid charge, are unfair.
attributes.background: All drivers must be allowed a fair period to pay original toll or parking fees before any fines are applied. Excessive, opportunistic fines must not be escalated to CCJs years later with added interest or fees, as this causes undue financial harm, stress, and long-term hardship for ordinary drivers.

rejection.details:
There are already open petitions on these issues: 

Increase regulation of parking signage 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/728920

Require car parks to have an on-site payment point
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/716309

Create a set of standards for private parking firms that ensure transparency
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/718339
